headline: Poor menstrual hygiene, risk factor for reproductive infections, says physician

“Menstrual hygiene is very important because it is a component of reproductive health.

“Menstrual hygiene education is embedded in sex education.

headline: CBN Retains Interest Rate at 11.5%
summarized_story:

The apex bank also left the Cash Reserve Ratio at 27.5 per cent and Liquidity Ratio at 30 per cent.
The MPR is the rate at which the CBN lends to commercial banks and often determines the cost of borrowing in the economy.

“As a responsible global corporate citizen, LG Electronics is set to contributing to the achievement of the SDGs as the main goal of its social contribution activities.
Some of such that promote eco-friendly society include LG DUAL Inverter, LG NeON 2, LG WashTower and the CordZero M9 robot vacuum cleaner.

headline: ARAN commends FG over efforts to recover stolen artifacts -NigPilot
summarized_story:
Artifacts Rescuers Association of Nigeria , (ARAN) a body responsible for the rescue of Nigeria artifacts and its patrimonies has commended Minister of Information and Culture, Alhaji Lai Mohammed, over his recent call for all artifacts looted from Nigeria by foreigners to be returned.
The President, Obalosa Bamidele made the commendation in Abuja on Monday while speaking with journalists saying that Alhaji Mohammeds’ call is yielding fruitfulness with some foreign institutions with the nations’ patrimonies agreeing to negotiate with the country for possible returns.
The German Government and Museums, both of which are currently at the forefront of repatriating the nations’ antiquities set the stage for a global movement to restitute colonial loot with its March announcement that it planned to hand over some Benin bronze to Nigeria.
Also, the Jesus College at the University of Cambridge has pledged to return a bronze cockreal along with the University of Aberdeen in Europe, committed in returning a Benin bronze, head of an oba (king) in its possession, acquired in a way that is considered extremely immoral.
Obalosa reiterated committment of his associations’ readiness to continue working with the Federal Government and all security agents in the country, assuring that all Nigeria’s treasures will be returned.

headline: Film producers drums support for APGA aspirant -NigPilot
summarized_story:
The Chairman Board of Trustees (BOT), Association of Music, Film Producers and Marketers of Nigeria, (AMFPMN) , Mayor Uzoma Ubaoha said that Dr. Okwudili Christopher Ezenwankwo is the only credible aspirant among other aspirants within the All Progressive Grand Alliance (APGA).
He however cautioned All progressive Grand Alliance (APGA) not to make a serious mistake in giving the ticket to any other person instead of Dr. Okwudili Christopher Ezenwankwo.
It is not being done to give any body who is not a home based and never laboured for the party ticket to sell the party over-night.
Dr. Ezenwankwo has led the entire Anambra Markets and did marvelously well.
We in the music industry wants him, traders needs him because he consolidated all Anambra Markets and mingled with the common people,” he said.

headline: Ibori’s £4.2m Loot Returned To Delta State Govt – Accountant-General
summarized_story:
The Accountant General of the Federation, Ahmed Idris on Tuesday said the £4.2m looted by ex-Delta State Governor, James Ibori, has been returned to the state.
According to him, any recovery arising from looted funds from a particular state would go directly to the states.
“It was paid to Delta State,” he said when asked where the money was diverted to.
Honourable Chairman, any recovery arising from the looted funds from a particular state goes to the state.
The state governors will not even allow this to fly.”READ ALSO: FG Expects £4.2m Ibori Loot From UK Govt SoonHe added, “Some recoveries are for some state governments, specific state governments.

headline: FG’s Insistence On Open Grazing Points To A Hidden Agenda – Benue Govt
summarized_story:
Benue State Governor, Samuel Ortom on Tuesday said the Federal Government’s insistence on open grazing suggests it has a hidden agenda.
The Presidency had on Monday faulted the recent resolutions of the Southern Governors, including the ban on open grazing in the entire southern part of the country.
The Southern Governors, the Benue leader added, adopted ranching as the alternative method of rearing animals.
He added, “As it stands, the Presidency is the lone hand pushing for the continuation of open grazing and the return of cattle routes of 1950s and 60s.
Besides, the international best practice of animal husbandry is ranching; and that’s the stand of Benue State.”

headline: CBN Retains Monetary Policy Rates At 11.5%
summarized_story:
The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) has again voted to retain the monetary policy rate at 11.5 percent.
The announcement was made by the CBN governor, Godwin Emefiele during a press briefing at the CBN headquarters on Tuesday.
He explained that the move is expected to allow further economic growth, after the country exited recession in the fourth quarter of 2020, amid rising inflation.
The MPC also noted that at least 70% of Nigeria’s population must be vaccinated if the country means to achieve economic recovery.
Responding to questions on the CBN ban on cryptocurrency transactions in Nigerian banks, the CBN governor insisted that the encrypted nature of cryptocurrency transactions makes it hard for fraud to be investigated and criminals apprehended.

headline: Gunmen Kill Four Police Officers, Burn Down Station In Enugu
summarized_story:
Gunmen on Tuesday attacked Iwollo Oghe Police Station in Ezeagu Local Government Area of Enugu State, killing four officers.
The officers died of gunshot wounds sustained in a gun duel while trying to repel the attack.
An investigation has been launched into the attack to fish out the assailants and their cohorts.
Earlier in April, two officers were killed in an attack on a police station in Adani, Uzo-Uwani Local Government Area of Enugu State, raising concerns over incessant assaults on security formations in the largely peaceful South-East region.
To curtail these attacks, the Inspector-General of Police (IGP), Usman Baba last week launched a special operation designed to restore peace to the South-East.

headline: Army To Hold Passing Out Parade For Recruits One Week After Attahiru’s Death
summarized_story:
The Passing Out Parade (POP) of the 80 Regular Recruit Intakes (RRI) has been postponed to May 29 following the death of the Chief of Army Staff (COAS), Lt.-Gen. Ibrahim Attahiru.
Attahiru, alongside 10 other senior military personnel died last week Friday in a plane crash in Kaduna State.
Audu Arigu, Assistant Director, Army Public Relations, Nigerian Army Depot, announced the postponement via a statement on Tuesday.
The ceremony was originally scheduled for May 22 with the late Army chief supposed to serve as Reviewing Officer and Special Guest of Honour.
He said the event was the climax of the recruits’ intensive training, adding that the ceremony showcases the height of military discipline and regimentation.

headline: Ebonyi State Government denies suicide bomber explosion, says incident was an accident
summarized_story:
Ebonyi State Government has denied that there was a Suicide Bomber explosion in the state.
The Ebonyi State Government, Southern, Nigeria has flayed the reports that a particular suicide bomber had detonated explosives attached to his body in the state.
He said “My attention has been drawn to a news making the round in some section of the media that there was an explosion of a suicide bomb in Afikpo, Ebonyi State this afternoon.
“A similar incident equally occurred in front of the Ebonyi State Old Government House as some mobile police officers were servicing their APC machine.
“Furthermore, Ebonyians and residents of Ebonyi State are reminded that generating and spreading of fake news aimed at causing panic in the state is actionable.

headline: Bandits Kill Ten In Five Zamfara Communities Unspecified number of Persons Abducted -
summarized_story: Bandits have killed ten persons and several others were abducted in five Zamfara communitiesThe Communities are Dandamji, Gidan Runji, Doka, Yanmadanga and Yarkatsina all in Bungudu local government area of the stateThe bandits invaded the communities Monday evening on motorcycles with sophisticated weaponsUnspecified number of persons were abducted and livestock were also taken awayThe spokesperson of the Zamfara State Police Command Shehu Mohammed Confirmed the incident to TVC NEWSAdvertisementHe says troops are on the trial of the criminals to ensure the safe return of the abducted persons.

headline: Nigeria: Southern Governors’ Ban on Open Grazing ‘Show of Power’, Garba Shehu Insists
summarized_story:
The Nigerian Presidency is insisting that the ban by the country’s Southern Governors on open Grazing is a show of power as they proffered no alternatives or solutions.
Garba Shehu, a senior special assistant on media to President Muhammadu Buhari stated this on Tuesday when he appeared on ARISE News.
According to the presidential aide, the objectives of both the southern governors and the president in terms of putting an end to open grazing are the same.
He noted that while President Buhari wants to see ranching, he wants it done in an organised manner.
He however called on the governors who have kicked against the alternative to open grazing provided by the President to respect the office of the Nigerian President.

headline: Nigeria Needs to Localise Police to Keep Up with Armed Non-state Actors: Tanwa Ashiru
summarized_story:
Tanwa Ashiru, a security and intelligence analyst, and a US Air Force veteran who worked in the Department of Defense and the US National Security Agency spoke to ARISE News on Nigeria’s security challenges and possible solutions.
These include the framework for a national dialogue, the import of ISWAP and Boko Haram joining forces, and localising police to help subdue armed non-state actors.
Watch this insightful video for more.

headline: Education Key to Unlocking the Potential in Africa’s Music Industry: Godwin Tom
summarized_story:
Godwin Tom is an African entertainment industry change agent constantly driving innovations in management within the music and entertainment industry.
Founder of Music Business Academy for Africa and CEO iManage Africa Entertainment Limited,he hascover 18 years as a talent manager and business executive and has practical experience at management level in marketing, public relations, image consulting, branding, and publishing.
Over the years, he has successfully worked with or managed talents such as Wizkid, Davido, Waje, MI, Wande Coal, Bez, Ice Prince, Show Dem Camp, to mention a few.
Bringing professionalism to the entertainment industry with an understanding of the demands of a business environment, he is now introducing The Music Business Academy for Africa 2021, a platform dedicated to training and developing an informed and empowered workforce for Africa’s entertainment industry.
He speaks with Seyitan Atigarin in this interview.

headline: Nigeria: Repatriated £4.2m Ibori Loot ‘Returned to Delta State’
summarized_story:
Nigeria’s Accountant-General, Ahmed Idris says the recently repatriated £4.2 million loot recovered from a former governor of Delta State, James Ibori and his associates has been returned to the state government.
The Accountant General of the Federation told members of the ad hoc committee of the House of Representatives that the money was returned to the state to avoid litigation against the federal government.
Some recoveries are for state governments, and when they come, we will send them to the state governments, including the Ibori loot.
“The recovery of the Ibori loot was paid to Delta state.
The states will not allow their monies to be taken; they will take us to court, and we don’t joke with that.”By Abel Ejikeme

headline: Nigeria: Gunmen Kill Four Police Officers in Southeastern Enugu
summarized_story:
Gunmen in the early hours of Tuesday attacked the Iwollo Police Division in Ezeagu Local Government Area of Enugu State and razed the station.
The Commissioner of Police in Enugu State, Mr Mohammed Aliyu, who confirmed the attack in a statement said he was already on ground to ascertain the level of destruction and casualties.
The eyewitness said that the attack threw the entire Iwollo community into fear and panic throughout the night.
Recall that on April 21, unknown gunmen shot two police operatives dead during an attack on Adani Police Station in Uzo-Uwani Local Government Area of Enugu State.
The station was also set ablaze completely at about 2:30 am.
